abstract: A type that represents the components of a locale, for use when creating a locale with specific overrides.
overview:
## Overview

Use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/Components] with the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/init(components:)] initializer to create a custom [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale] that overrides specific traits of a default locale. When you create a locale with components, the locale uses any overridden values instead of defaults preferred by the region or language. Leave a property `nil` to accept the default value.

The properties in this type correspond with those in [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale], which declares them as read-only rather than read-write. You use this type to customize components when creating a custom locale, and use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale] to examine the components of an existing locale.

The following example creates a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/Components] instance for US English, but then customizes its components. It sets the first day of the week to Monday and the hour cycle to zero-to-23. These components override the `en-US` defaults of Sunday and one-to-12, respectively. It then uses [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/init(components:)] to create a custom [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale].

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Foundation/Locale/Components
crawled: 2025-12-02T17:04:36Z
---

# Locale.Components

**Structure**

A type that represents the components of a locale, for use when creating a locale with specific overrides.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Components
```

## Overview

Use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/Components] with the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/init(components:)] initializer to create a custom [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale] that overrides specific traits of a default locale. When you create a locale with components, the locale uses any overridden values instead of defaults preferred by the region or language. Leave a property `nil` to accept the default value.

The properties in this type correspond with those in [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale], which declares them as read-only rather than read-write. You use this type to customize components when creating a custom locale, and use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale] to examine the components of an existing locale.

The following example creates a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/Components] instance for US English, but then customizes its components. It sets the first day of the week to Monday and the hour cycle to zero-to-23. These components override the `en-US` defaults of Sunday and one-to-12, respectively. It then uses [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale/init(components:)] to create a custom [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Locale].

```swift
var components = Locale.Components(languageCode: "en", languageRegion: "US")
components.firstDayOfWeek = Locale.Weekday.monday
components.hourCycle = Locale.HourCycle.zeroToTwentyThree
let locale = Locale(components: components)
```

## Creating a locale components instance

- **init(identifier:)**: Creates a locale components instance with the specified identifier.
- **init(languageCode:script:languageRegion:)**: Creates a locale components instance with the specified language code, script, and region identifier.
- **init(locale:)**: Creates a language components instance from an existing locale.

## Specifying language components

- **languageComponents**: The Unicode language identifier part of a locale.
- **Locale.Language.Components**: A type that identifies a language by its various components.

## Specifying date and time components

- **calendar**: The calendar used by the locale.
- **Calendar.Identifier**: An enumeration for the available calendars.
- **firstDayOfWeek**: The first day of the week as represented by this locale.
- **Locale.Weekday**: A type that represents weekdays, used for indicating a locale’s first day of the week.
- **hourCycle**: The hour cycle used by the locale, like one-to-twelve or zero-to-twenty-three.
- **Locale.HourCycle**: A type that represents the hour cycle used in a locale, like one-to-twelve or zero-to-twenty-three.
- **timeZone**: The time zone used by the locale.

## Specifiying measurement and counting components

- **currency**: The currency used by the locale.
- **Locale.Currency**: A type that represents the currency system used by a locale, like dollars or euros.
- **measurementSystem**: The measurement system used by the locale, like metric or the US system.
- **Locale.MeasurementSystem**: A type that represents the measurement system used by a locale, like metric or the US system.
- **numberingSystem**: The numbering system used by the locale.
- **Locale.NumberingSystem**: A type that represents the numbering system used in a locale.

## Specifying region components

- **region**: The region used by the locale.
- **Locale.Region**: A type that represents a geographic region, for use in specifying a locale or language.
- **subdivision**: The optional subdivision of the region used by this locale.
- **Locale.Subdivision**: A type that represents a subdivision of a region, such as a state in the US or a province in Canada.
- **variant**: An optional variant used by the locale.
- **Locale.Variant**: A type that represents a locale’s languate variant.

## Specifying ordering components

- **collation**: The string sort order of the locale.
- **Locale.Collation**: A type that represents the string sort order used by the locale.

## Creating a locale by components

- **init(components:)**: Creates a locale from the given components.
- **init(languageCode:script:languageRegion:)**: Creates a locale with the specified language code, script, and region identifier.
- **init(languageComponents:)**: Creates a locale from the given language components.
- **Locale.Language.Components**: A type that identifies a language by its various components.

## Conforms To

- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
